titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I motored into Durham, and presided at the meeting of the Diocesan Conference.
When I entered the Chapter House I was welcomed with a good deal of cheering, which at least indicated a kindly disposition towards me

. I addressed the Conference very briefly, making allusion to the Report of the Coal Commission, & directing the clergy to preface the Prayer for Parliament with a brief reference to the special need for Divine guidance of the Prime Minister & his colleagues. I gave lunch in the Common Room of the Castle to M
Shaddick, Miss Headlam, & Lionel. Delegating the chairmanship of the Conference during the afternoon to the Bishop of Jarrow, I returned to Auckland, & wrote letters.
